name: Novotel Brussels Grand Place

reviews.text: The hotel is ideally located a very short walk from the train station. We where a group of eight - 4 couples.
reviews.title: Great location and good rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room even had a lovely view out to the "plaza" right in front of the hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean. I liked especially the bathtub, small, buy comfy. Brussels felt like a tiny town - you could walk everywhere!
reviews.title: Tucked away from the crowd.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What was chaotic was the breakfast seating. Every day when we came down the breakfast area was full and we had to wait. Sometimes it actually was crowded, but most of the time it was just the staff that hadn't managed to clean the free tables. I don't know if they were under-staffed or just badly coordinated... Mostly the last suggestion I think. When finally getting a table, the breakfast buffet was great, fresh and varied. Again, they were not so good refilling food/beverage that were emptied. That again, we saw as poor work organization.
reviews.title: Good hotel but very noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, despite the breakfast organization - the hotel is nice, modern and light. And is really recommended!
reviews.title: good hotel in perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't stay at this hotel. The only name and address we have for the restaurant is the hotel business card. The restaurant in this hotel offers a Sunday brunch. It is very near the Grand Place. It offers a nice choice of dishes. As with all such restaurants, the menu items are very reasonable but they do make up with costs of drinks!
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: Just had 3 nights at the Novotel and would not hesitate to stay again. Rooms are clean, spacious and modern. Easy to sleep as very dark and quiet. It is a great location, 1 minute from grand place and 2 minutes walk from central station, which is only 1 stop from brussels midi if you are on eurostar. Rack rate is over €200 but there are some great deals around - i paid £260 for 3 nights inc. breakfast, return eurostar through railbookers. I thought this was great value. The breakfast was good except for the hot selection which was very bland and greasy. I wouldnt pay extra for it though. Staff very friendly and helpful. Overall Excellent.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, great location.

reviews.text: We stayed here after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, and were not disappointed. It really is just 2 minutes walk from the Grande Place.
reviews.title: Perfect Weekend!

likes.disliked: — No views to shout about, but that's not its fault!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're going for the Christmas markets (as we were) you might want to find somewhere closer to the larger part of the market, but we didn't mind walking over there in the evenings and there were small patches of stalls in this part of the city as well, plus all of the restaurants and shops. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel !

likes.liked: — The location - you can't get any better ..... unless you are central if the main square !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and stylish, we had a cot for our baby that looked brand new, and the breakfasts were more than ample and although not cheap, much easier than trekking around trying to find an English breakfast - beans, bacon, sausage, eggs, toast, different types of bread, cereals, cheeses, fruit yoghurt, all the usuals you'd expect.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I can't find anything to criticise about this hotel, a rarity for me!
reviews.title: Brand new, nice rooms, great breakfast, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent 3 nights here and coudn't fault it. We were concerned when we had the room directly opposite the lift with the shoe shine outside our door but it was never a noise problem, possibly as we always shut the internal door also. We were on the very top floor overlooking the square which we were also concerned might be noisy but there was only noise for a short time one night with the typical youth problem in most of our cities. The hotel was very clean and modern and the staff were very helpful. The breakfast was great and we feel we had a very good deal by booking B&B on their website for 268.50 Euros in total. The location was the best part as everything was an easy walk away (although you have to be aware of the very uneven cobbles!). It's definitely worth a visit at this time of year to see The Grand Place light show, the ice rink, carousels and market stalls. We flew from Southampton so were in our room in the time it would've taken for us to get to Gatwick! We had some great meals in Le Grand Cafe near the Bourse. We even had fine weather. The only dowside is the cost of a taxi to/from the airport which is about 40 Euros and our driver was doing 135 in a 90 limit .....and taking a phone call!! Always the scariest part of any travelling.
reviews.title: Great location to visit Christmas Markets

likes.disliked: — I honestly can't think of anything remotely annoying or bad

reviews.title: Wonderful central location for tourists
reviews.text: Fantastic location near central station and Grand Place. Very comfortable room with large bed and sofa. Access to bathroom a bit difficult as french doors leading into it knocked against bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet excellent. Internet access on computers near reception is very expensive.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We had a great 2 night stay at the this hotel. We arrived at half past midnight and were treated with courtesy by reception staff. The young man also gave advice on where to find a cashpoint so we could go out for a drink.
reviews.title: Fabulous location and great deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was lovely. We stayed in 209 which was very spacious, had two little seating areas and overlooked the square outside. The location could not have been more convenient.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Stayed here with my family in early April. The Hotel is 5 minutes from the Grand Place and two minutes from Central Station if you want to take a train to Bruges. Hotel is spotless and appears well insulated from the noises on the street. Staff are excellent - very polite and helpful. Continental breakfast at €10.50 per adult (kids free) is great value and set us up for the day's sightseeing. The staff were particulary kind to the children especially a dark haired lady running the breakfast service and one of the reception staff who gave the kids a couple of free gifts on departure. At €114 per night for a family of four I have to recommend this highly. Our kids are 5 and 9. The room was compact but very comfortable with a pull out couch bed and double bed. This is a fine good value hotel excellent for seeing the city.
reviews.title: Great value hotel in perfect location
Great choice for Brussels
reviews.text: Caught the train to Midi from Amsterdam. Good thing to know that if you come in on a long distance train you can catch the 2 min train to Central Station for free. This hotel is literally a 2 min walk from Central station. Fantastic location, so good you can nip back to hotel to drop off your parcels or go to the bathroom. Mauricio and David were very helpful at reception. The room was nice, lovely bathroom with both bath & shower and a separate loo. Only complaint -rock hard bed and uncomfortable pillows. Our restaurant experiences were not good on both days. Stay away from Mocafe in the Galleria. Ate at Leons, had the mussels, very expensive and just not worth it. Found this city to be very expensive. We can buy some of the same Belgian chocolates cheaper at home in S Africa.

The hotel is perfectly located near to the central train station and on the edge of the Grand Place. Absolutely everything you would want to visit is within walking distance. I doubt you could better the location!
reviews.title: Perfect for a city break!

reviews.text: The Novotel is exactly what you would expect... Clean, good value, good facilities and a brand-like feel. Staff were exceptional at all times and very efficient. The room was available at 130!! No issues apart from the bed which was rock hard and a lack of towels. We were on the 1st floor to the rear of the property and were woken by noises outside in the early hours. Can imagine that the noise would be even worse at the front of the hotel. A small issue given the hotels location.
reviews.title: elegant and fine hotel, in the hearth of Bruxelles

reviews.text: Overall a great hotel. Not luxurious but great value and a perfect base to explore Brussels. Novotel have got the city break hotel down to a tee!
reviews.title: Very Handy and Great Rooms

reviews.text: This would be a full 5 star review if not for the noise. Totally not the hotels fault, they cannot control the people yelling on the street, but maybe some thicker glass on the room. The location is perfect. Its literally steps away from the Grand Place and about 4 blocks from the mannekin. The best part about this was the service of the front desk. We were unfamiliar with the area and asked where was the best place to eat. The desk clerk gave us a valuable tip. NEVER go into a place that has a person out front trying to convince you to come in. If the place was any good, they wouldnt be asking. He showed us the famous stretch of restaurants and said, dont go to any of these. He then pointed out the place to go and it was one of the best meals we ever had. He also told us that the mussels were out of season at that time (early June) and any restaurant that is advertising them is not worth our time. Parking is only about a block away as well in a secure garage for a reasonable price. If you are going to Bruxells, this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: Awesome but noisy.

reviews.text: Conveniently located just next to Grand Place. Easy access to a lot of tourist attractions in Brussels, not to mention restaurants & "frites" vendors. Train station is within walking distance, as well as stops for hop on hop off tourist bus. A laundromat is also close by if needed.
reviews.title: Good place to stay near Grand Place

reviews.text: The hotel interior is quite modern, standard Accor group fare. We had lower floor room, the outside noise could get in, but should not be a problem on higher floors.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: This was my first staying in Novotel and Xth in Brussels. During my previous visits, I visited the Novotel restaurant and have to say that they have been always polite and ready to serve. I had a room at one of the upper floor, the room is nicely equipped with modern technical facilities. Wi-fi is free, however a Trojan virus almost damaged my PC, had a trouble to restore it. In front of elevator there are signs to watch out on pocket, it's a central area, generally it's safe with a lot of young people but for somebody coming from Switzerland where you can "eat from the street", it's shocking to see so dirty streets, but it doesn't have anything with hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel Review
Great hotel in a great location
reviews.text: Good Breakfast. Hotel seems little small. The location is quite centrally located. Railway Station is quite close by. Hardly 3 min walk from the Hotel. Many good Restaurants close by for other cheap option to satisfy your taste buds.

We have just come back from a weekend break in the Novotel Brussels Off Grand Place and I cannot sing their praises highly enough. I am disabled and contacted them a couple of days before we arrived to ask for a room with facilities for the less abled and also a room for my sister and husband close by in case I needed help, they replied the following morning with the assurance that I would have a room with easier accessability and also a view over the sqaure. When we arrived I could not believe the size of the room and the bathroom. It was amazing along with plenty of handgrips in the large bath and a higher toilet. We had a brilliant view of the square and market as well as the Brussels Marathon on Sunday morning.
reviews.title: Fantastic for disabled holiday makers

likes.liked: — Central location, friendly staff, excellent breakfast, disabled bedroom was very good.
likes.disliked: — Thought the bar area was stark.

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good, I don't understand the former comment regarding the runny scrambled egg, it was really very good as well as lots of crispy bacon, sausages, warm pastries, cereals, fresh juice & fruit as well as pots of coffee (as many as you like).
reviews.title: If your staying in Brussels, stay at The Novotel Grand Place

likes.liked: — Location in realtion to Central Brussels
likes.disliked: — If i'm being really picky the corridors on the 5th floor where our room was needed refreshing. That's it really.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had great fun watching the English rugby team beat the French on the widescreen TV in the bar, much to some of the French guests disgust but they took it all in good fun.
reviews.title: Great Location, Typical Novotel

reviews.text: The hotel is very central for finding places to eat, the station, the sight seeing buses, the Grand Place, shops(especially chocolate)and all the sights anyone would like to see. There is a taxi rank right outside the front door of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location, Pretty Good Service, Skip Breakfast

likes.disliked: — Restaurant and bar are cold and overpriced.

reviews.text: All in all I would recommend this hotel and are planning another visit very soon.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.text: This was a very nice stay during our very quick stop in Brussels. The hotel is very clean, and convenient to everything from Grand Place, restaurants, hop on hop off, shops, and the train station. Couldn't ask for a better location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Didn't have the breakfast there as we found it to be rather expensive, so I am not sure of the quality there. Ordered room service which was quick and very good. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel and it was around 50 Euro, so be prepared and it takes about 40 minutes. Overall, a great place to stay while in Brussels.
reviews.title: Perfect Location
Very good hotel in a very convenient location
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at the Novotel Grand Place. The room was modern, well designed and clean. The bed and bathroom were also very nice. The location is excellent - very close to the Grand Place and central station. The breakfast was good but the service was poor. The prices are OK if you book early and get a deal.
We had a room overlooking the back of the hotel which was much more quiet than the front.
reviews.title: Not a top end 4* - great location though

reviews.text: Location is really good, breakfast is alright too. The free Internet access was a nice touch and the staff were all lovely.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and excellent location.

reviews.text: We were a little disappointed with our one night stay, mainly because the hotel was fairly ordinary and felt like a good 3* rather than 4. Our bed was a fold out double, the cups and glasses provided were plastic and all in all, it was fine but not really that different to what I'm sure the ibis next door provides for half the price.
reviews.title: Excellent Family hotel

reviews.text: I have seen this hotel 'officially' rated as a 2 or 3 star hotel and I think this does it an injustice. Its refurbishment work has made it a clean, pleasant and modern place to stay. The rooms are comfortable with a flat screen TV, tea making facilities and ample wardrobe space (although no drawers). The bathroom shower was very powerful and toilettries are provided.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay - value for money

likes.disliked: — One particular female member of staff in the restaurant

reviews.text: However, like previous visitors I must say we had 2 minor incidents which although did not mar our stay still should be mentioned. Firstly, on one of the days of our stay our bathroom was not cleaned and no clean towels were given. However, this was soon rectified by a quick visit to reception and a cleaner came up to the room straight away and an apology given. The second is that they seem to have a problem with the attitude of a couple of staff members. Especially one female staff member working in the restaurant. We found her aggressive and unhelpful - giving us cold water for our tea and being very offhand in her manner.
reviews.title: Great location - typical hotel

reviews.text: If they could sort out their staffing issues - both the haphazard cleaner and resturant staff this would be a great hotel. I must point out these quibbles are very mior and we otherwise had an excellent stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others :)
reviews.title: Best Location but Some Problems

likes.disliked: — Front desk staff, problems with swipe card key.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Travelling with children it is often difficult to get a hotel that can cater for us. The Novotel had your typical hotel room but atleast it had 2 double beds to squeeze us in. Inside you could be anywhere in the world so if you are after something unique it is probably not the place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are after a clean standard hotel room that is in the best location in all of Brussels then this is the one for you. A 1 minute walk and you are in the heart of the square and all that Brussels has to offer - you must try the bannana and chocolate waffles!
reviews.title: Great location and a comfortable room for a resonable price.

aka: Novotel Brussels Grand Place Hotel Brussels
description: The Novotel Brussels Off Grand Place is located right in the centre of Brussels, moments away from what is said to be the most beautiful town square in the world. Within easy reach of Central Station, this 138 room hotel combines comfort and innovation.The lobby and the Foodsquare bar brasserie share a warm and bright open space, a celebration of chic design. This 4 star hotel welcomes you in this historic area of Brussels for a weekend or short break with your partner or family.
